MessageType.Doc: Provides a problem $A x = b$, with $A$ a known matrix encoded in the edge weights.

Scalar.name: x

Scalar.name: b

MessageType.Doc: Provides a solution to $A x = b$.

Scalar.name: x
Scalar.Doc: Solution. Part of $x=x_(1)$.

Scalar.name: r
Scalar.Doc: Global residual of the solution. $r = max(A x - b)$.

Scalar.name: i
Scalar.Doc: Number of iterations used.

MessageType.Doc: Shares a current solution to $A_(i) x_(i) = b_(i)$.

Scalar.name: x
Scalar.Doc: Solution. Part of $x=x_(i)$.

Scalar.name: stage
Scalar.Doc: Identifies which stage this is (e.g. pre-smooth vs post-smooth)

MessageType.Doc:
Messages being sent up the grid, in order to solve $A_(i) x_(i) = b_(i)$, where $A_(i)$ is some restricted version of $A_(i) = R_(i) A_(i-1)$, and $b_(i)$ is a restricted version of the residual $R_(i) (A_(i-1) x_(i-1) - b_(i-1))$.
$max(r)$ is the _local_ maximum residual, i.e. it is a part of $max( A_0 x_0 - b_0) on the finest level, but only covers the parts of the cone the device is connected to.

Scalar.name: b
Scalar.Doc: Value to solve for. Part of b_(i-1)

Scalar.name: max_r
Scalar.Doc: Max residual of all finer nodes (though not for whole network)

MessageType.Doc: Corrections sent down the grid. These will be prolonged back onto the finer solution, so $x_(i) = x_(i) + P_(i+1) x_(i+1)$. $max(r)$ is the _global_ maximum residual for the original version of x at the finest level of the grid.

Scalar.name: x
Scalar.Doc: Best guess for $x_(i+1)$

Scalar.name: max_r
Scalar.Doc: Max residual of all nodes (for the whole network)

Scalar.name: fineTotal
Scalar.Doc: Number of fine that we receive from (not nesc. that we send to)

Scalar.name: R

DeviceType.Doc: This is the finest level linear solver, with one device per element in the original problem matrix. The finest is not the same as the middle-tier nodes, as it needs to control the iteration until residual is met (though this could be controlled by a property and a state).
